intro: Capura zollingerianus, commonly known as the Zollinger's capura, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
